intro: Museniopsis biennis, commonly known as the annual museniopsis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Museniopsis biennis is an annual species, completing its life cycle within a single growing season. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for gardens in suitable climates.
